Disease specific approach to preoperative special investigations ‘Active, no documented medical illness, no Finger prick Hb only medications Hypertension Formal Hb Creatinine Na/K if using digoxin, diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEIs) or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) ECG Diabetes Formal Hb Finger prick glucose in all HBA, C Creatinine Na/K if using digoxin, diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEIs) or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) Ischaemic heart disease Formal Hb Creatinine Na/K if using digoxin, diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEs) or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) ECG Echo - Decision to perform an echo (formal or screening) should be decided on a case by case basis in consultation with an Anaesthetist Heart Failure Formal Hb Creatinine Na/K if using digoxin, diuretics, angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors (ACEIs) or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs) Respiratory disease ‘Well controlled, compliant, asymptomatic Nil Poorly controlled / uncharacterized dyspnoea or exercise intolerance that is unexplainable’ / Lung function tests Symptomatic COPD or asthma / Admission for respiratory aetiology or oral steroid use in last year
